questions.query: Email Address
questions.explanation: greenpill9ja@gmail.com

questions.query: Team Size
Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
questions.explanation: Greenpill

questions.query: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
Our key goals and milestones for this year are focused on driving meaningful environmental and social impact in Nigeria: 
> Water Cup Initiative (Q4 2024 – Q4 2025) in partnership with Atlantis to improve access to clean water across Nigeria.  
> National Cleanup Tournament (Q2 2025) involving up to 15 communities to combat plastic waste pollution.  
> Hackathon(Q3 2025) with Atlantis, Greenpill Dev Guild, and other protocols to build innovative solutions for local challenges.  
> Tree Planting Campaign (Q3 2025) with Refi Lagos, Silvi, and other partners to increase tree coverage and fruit availability.  
> Impactful Summit (Q4 2025) to showcase and celebrate impactful initiatives and changemakers.  
> Ongoing educational and Degen to Regen movements to raise awareness and inspire action within our community.  

 These initiatives align with our mission to create long-term environmental and social impact, strengthening Nigeria’s sustainability efforts.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

We’re rallying all Web3 projects to start embedding philanthropy in their organization by integrating the Glo Dollar stablecoin in their platform and/or treasury. By doing so these organizations bring three benefits to the world: (1) directly contribute to funding basic incomes for people in extreme poverty, (2) spread the word about Glo Dollar to a bigger audience, indirectly growing basic income funding, and (3) opportunity to join the Glo Consortium to further collaborate on reducing extreme poverty. Glo Dollar is collaborating with Arbitrum DAO to bring a total of $10,000 in USDGLO in matching for organizations that embed philanthropy. Whether you're already part of the Glo Consortium or looking to dive into Glo, this round is for you.
data.title: Glo Dollar x Arbitrum DAO

questions.query: How should the success of your grant be measured?
questions.explanation: How many citizens are rewarded for their valued contribution.

questions.query: What is the intended direct impact your project will have on the ecosystem?
What is the long-term impact of your grant?
questions.explanation: Catalyst for knowledge transfer via execution.

questions.query: How will the grant funds be used?
questions.explanation: allocated into a matching pool on Allo Protocol to be distributed to contributors.

questions.query: How will receiving a grant enable you to foster growth or innovation within the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: With the notion of impact=profit, we aim to reward value in order to ignite impactful contributions.

data.description:
We will initiate a mini Citizen's round to reward our ecosystem contributors within the region. The funding received from this round will be allocated towards the matching pool for that mini round. 

The thought is that due to the limited funds, instead of reaching each individual in the region, we can reward contributors in order to create knowledge transfer for the broader community to contribute impactfully.
data.title: Start Greenpill Nigeria Citizen's Round

data.reason:
## Overview

We recently held a Citizens Round to recognize past and ongoing contributions to Greenpill Nigeria and the African ReFi (Regenerative Finance) space. The round involved three council members who allocated 1,000 points to six candidates. The round used the Easyretro PGF platform, with applications open from September 27 to October 5. After reviewing submissions, council members voted between October 7 and October 11, and the final results were announced during an [XSpace](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1MnGnDrrAEoxO) event on October 18.

Round operators: Amio and Izzy
## Objective

The round aimed to:

- Reward valuable contributions to Greenpill Nigeria and ReFi initiatives.
- Set clear goals and intentions for future projects.
- Gather insights from the council on community priorities.
- Educate badge holders for future participation.

## Execution

### Pre-Round Preparation

We initiated a call for volunteers through our Telegram platform, inviting individuals to serve as council members. These council members were briefed on the scope of their responsibilities and instructed to consider the following factors when evaluating candidates:

1. **Past Contributions:** Assess candidates based on their previous work.
2. **Verification:** Confirm the validity of claimed contributions.
3. **Application Quality:** Evaluate the clarity and thoroughness of the applications.
4. **Reward Criteria:** Candidates were judged on contributions to the following categories:
    - **Awareness:** Efforts to raise brand awareness, such as social media activity or public mentions.
    - **Operations:** Initiatives that improve the coordination of Greenpill Nigeria and ecosystem partners.
    - **Environmental Initiatives:** Work in areas like tree planting, waste management, solar distribution, or environmental data analysis.
    - **Education:** Efforts to educate others about Greenpill Nigeria or the broader ReFi movement.
    - **Community Building:** Activities that bring people together to work on regenerative goals.

### Pre-Round Awareness

To encourage participation, we implemented several outreach strategies:

- Co-hosted an [XSpace](https://x.com/GreenpillNaija/status/1839353950195355761) on public goods retro funding with the Pro Nouns community.
- Sent direct invitations to known contributors.
- Held daily Telegram workshops for potential applicants.
- Used social media to promote the round and invite participants.

### Voting Process

After applications were submitted, council members were given 1,000 points to allocate among six approved candidates, based on the established criteria. Here's how each council member approached their decision:

- **CJ:** Focused on alignment with Greenpill Nigeria's mission of sustainability and regeneration. He prioritized projects with demonstrated impact, innovation, and community engagement.
- **Princewill:** Emphasized visibility and sustainability, considering the broader needs of the sector.
- **Mmerichuckwu:** Based his decisions on candidates' track records, supplementing the incomplete applications with independent online research.

To hear more of this process feel free to listen to the retrospective [X space](https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1MnGnDrrAEoxO). 

### Results

The 1,000 points was distributed as follows (based on average votes):

- **Mercy (TAS project):** 260
- **Ada (AfriLearn):** 220
- **Emmanuel (PHweb3connect):** 183
- **Whizrael Graphics:** 117
- **Jude:** 110
- **Sanitation BCFET:** 110

## Challenges and Solutions

Several issues arose during the round:

1. **Platform Accessibility:** The Easyretro PGF platform had connectivity issues in Nigeria.
2. **Application Clarity:** Some candidates misunderstood the application format, submitting projects instead of properly identifying themselves.
3. **Short Timeline:** Both the awareness campaign and application period were too brief.

### Proposed Solutions

- Ensure all participants have access to a the necessary software.
- Provide clearer guidance during workshops and improve the instructions on the application page.
- Establish a dedicated feedback channel for applicants.
- Start promotion 1-2 months before the next round to give applicants more preparation time.

## Next Steps

For Q1, our focus will include:

- Assigning council members for the Gardens project.
- Revisiting the reward criteria to align with 2025 milestones:
    - Education
    - Regional Awareness
    - Environmental Initiatives
    - Operations
    - Community Building
- Funding Gardens based on the Q1-Q2 budget.
- Initiating conviction voting for priority sectors.

[Forum read](https://hub.greenpill.network/t/greenpill-nigeria-citizen-s-reward-retrospect/149)

## Next Steps

For Q1, our focus will include:

- Assigning council members for the Gardens project.
- Revisiting the reward criteria to align with 2025 milestones:

    - Operations

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

data.name: $EARTH
data.description: $EARTH - Digital currency backed by real world climate solutions, ecosystem services and solarpunk values

We initiated a Retro Reward round with Easy RetroPGF to appreciate our valued contributors and also establish an on-chain foundation of active contributors. We are rewarding in the following sectors:

**- Awareness:**
    - Any initiative that will help increase brand awareness. This includes X spaces, social media posts. Mentions in other communities etc.
**- Operations**
    - Any initiative that helps with coordinating Greenpill Nigeria and its ecosystem partners.
- **Environmental initiatives**
    - Individuals part of projects that is working in the environmental and climate sector. For example tree planting, waste management, solar energy distribution, etc.
- **Education**
    - Any individual that is educating others on Greenpill Nigeria or ReFi as a whole.
- **Community**
    - Any one that cultivates the community and brings groups together for a common regenerative goal.

[Round link](https://easyretropgf.xyz/greenpill-nigeria-citizens-rewards)
data.title: Regen Coordi-Nation Genesis

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation: We aim to create an initiative called "Plastic Flywheel." This is a plan to reward contributors on the Celo chain for their recycle efforts. In addition to this flywheel, we are establishing Celo minipay as our ecosystem projects' "point of sale" terminals.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you are yet to participate).
questions.explanation: After our previous Gitcoin rounds, we have managed to: 1) Incubate more than 3 viable projects in the Depin, Environmental, and Education sector. 2) We have conducted one and plan on running another grant round for our community in October. 3) We have also created a group of project leads to experiment with governance and community strategies to implement.

questions.query: Have you participated in any Octant epoch (Epoch 0 through Epoch 4) OR a previous Gitcoin Grants round? Please provide details and evidence of your participation.
questions.explanation: https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/greenpill-nigeria-impactprofit

questions.query: Please describe how your project contributes to the growth and development of the Octant ecosystem.
questions.explanation: We aim to use Octant as an example of public goods funding and governance in general. This information will increase engagement during the current Epoch.

questions.query: How does your project align with the round's focus on community and education within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation: GreenPill Nigeria aligns with the focus on education and community because as we continue our initiatives, we put community first and educating the community on ecosystem procedures is a vital part.

questions.query: Provide a clear roadmap of your project, detailing future milestones and deliverables. How does this demonstrate your commitment to long-term impact and growth within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
September- Host X spaces and tutorials on Nigeria's Public goods and Octant's governance and engagement procedures.

October- Conduct a citizen's round that is already in the planning process.

-Begin our "Plastic Flywheel" initiative and prepare for Epoch 4

-Educate community more on staking GLM.

November- Continue our "Plastic Flywheel" initiative.

-Educate the community more on the importance of community staking.

-Create a gamified incentive for longer staking.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise and how it contributes to the successful execution of your project.
questions.explanation:
The team is a mixture of different projects within the Nigerian region.

We have talent in the following:

-Educators

-Developers

-Event planners

-Content creators

-Project/program managers.

questions.query: How does your project complement or enhance existing initiatives within the Octant ecosystem rather than competing directly against them?
questions.explanation: It assists because we create org awareness in regions within Nigeria.

questions.query: Describe your approach to community engagement and how you plan to contribute to a collaborative and constructive funding environment.
questions.explanation:
Our approach to community engagement is to create a "call to action."

-Understand the needs of the community and find the best way to optimally incentivize community members.

-Create value for the community members based on the community's intended value proposition.

questions.query: How do you plan to use the funding to maximize your project's ongoing impact within the Octant ecosystem if selected?
questions.explanation: "We hear, we remember, we do, we know." Based on this philosophy, we will use the funding to educate the community via hands-on experience.

questions.query: What unique educational content or resources have you created for the Octant ecosystem? How has the community received these? Please share any relevant links
questions.explanation: We are working on creating X spaces and regular meetings to showcase Octant's allocation model.

data.name: Octant
data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

questions.query: Email Address
questions.explanation: greenpill9ja@gmail.com

questions.query: Team Size
Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
questions.explanation: Greenpill

questions.query: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
Our key goals and milestones for this year are focused on driving meaningful environmental and social impact in Nigeria: 
> Water Cup Initiative (Q4 2024 – Q4 2025) in partnership with Atlantis to improve access to clean water across Nigeria.  
> National Cleanup Tournament (Q2 2025) involving up to 15 communities to combat plastic waste pollution.  
> Hackathon(Q3 2025) with Atlantis, Greenpill Dev Guild, and other protocols to build innovative solutions for local challenges.  
> Tree Planting Campaign (Q3 2025) with Refi Lagos, Silvi, and other partners to increase tree coverage and fruit availability.  
> Impactful Summit (Q4 2025) to showcase and celebrate impactful initiatives and changemakers.  
> Ongoing educational and Degen to Regen movements to raise awareness and inspire action within our community.  

 These initiatives align with our mission to create long-term environmental and social impact, strengthening Nigeria’s sustainability efforts.
